comments.body:
imho, this else is not usefull ?.

``` python
if self.version:
    return xxxx
return xxxx
```

@Lujeni meh, it's really not that important. I prefer it the way it is, and you're entitled to your preference. 

Unless you can point to actual documentation backing up your preferences though (PEP-8, Ansible coding standards, etc.), I'm unlikely to change my code.
In order to skip the first path which is used by default, should not that be `[x for x in galaxy.roles_paths[1:]]` ?

@pilou- the "recovery" logic for the `try`/`except` in the install method that handles the "first path found can not be written to, try the next one" depends on the path existing in `self.paths` because it checks the index and steps through the list. https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/42a0d7141339295cf7fd2f5ed05d7ec2ef5cb8c1/lib/ansible/galaxy/role.py#L337

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +75,79 @@            self.path = os.path.join(galaxy.roles_paths[0], self.name)
            # create list of possible paths
            self.paths = [x for x in galaxy.roles_paths]
            self.paths = [os.path.join(x, self.name) for x in self.paths]

comments.body: We can name this key whatever. I picked 'source' because it corresponded to src and url was already taken in the galaxy api.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +246,250 @@                for role_version in role_versions:
                    if role_version['name'] == self.version and 'source' in role_version:
                        self.src = role_version['source']

                tmp_file = self.fetch(role_data)

comments.body: i would just add 'meta' here  and do 1 join vs 2 of em
That would require to add another `join` on the line 273. I think it has better readability as it's now.
I was trying to be fancy and indicate that the `a` is option. I should probably just spell it out and say something like `meta/main.[yml|yaml]`.
Oh, sorry for the density, that makes sense. :-)
